alert.note: Alert for Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 5:04PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, Meagher. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen between 4 pm and 5 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area between 5 pm and 6 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Sulphur Springs and Newlan Creek Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
